SharedMem:
["Jim and his friend Jonathan are taking a road trip.",
"They began in California, and are now passing through Michigan. It’s almost winter, so it’s very cold outside---especially for Southern California dwellers like them.",
"They see that they’re almost out of gas, so they stop at a gas station in a small town.",
"Jim fill up the tank, and then the two of them go inside the gas station to buy some water and snacks.",
"They return to the car and start up the engine"]
ScenarioPremise: Jonathan says “Man, it’s really cold in here"
Options:
["To turn on the heater",
"To say that the heater is broken",
"To wait for an answer",
"To say if the heater can be turned on"]
LcGoal: Jonathan would like to warm up
LcContext: As they leave the station, Jonathan shivers in his seat.
LcSpecificMem: Jonathan doesn't notice the blinking light, which indicates that the car’s heating system is broken
LcExtras: Jonathan is in the passenger seat
IlcGoal: Jim wants to continue the journey
IlcContext: As they leave the station, Jonathan shivers in his seat.
IlcSpecificMem: Jim notices the blinking light, which indicates that the car’s heating system is broken
Explicit_belief_illocutor: Jim knows that Jonathan doesn't notice that the heater is broken
Illocutor_answer: To say that the heater is broken

SharedMem:
["Marta has been renting a house with her two roommates, Lisa and Brian, for three months now.",
" Things are going well, though both Marta and Lisa are not very responsible about cleaning; consequently, the house has a tendency to get dirty quickly---unwashed dishes in the sink, cluttered counters, the whole shebang.",
"Even worse, Marta and Lisa are directly responsible for the latest mess, which is the product of a recent dinner party."]
ScenarioPremise: Brian says, “You guys really did a number on the kitchen.”
Options:
["To clean up the kitchen",
"To say that Lisa will clean up the kitchen",
"To wait for an answer",
"To say if Lisa will clean up the kitchen"]
LcGoal: Brian wants the kitchen to be clean
LcContext: Brian’s something of a neat freak, so he’s pretty anxious about the mess.
LcSpecificMem: Brian doesn't know that Lisa volunteered to take the lead on cleaning the kitchen when she gets home from work this evening.
LcExtras: In the afternoon, while Lisa is still at work, Marta and Brian are standing in the kitchen doorway, gazing in.
IlcGoal: Marta wants to wait for Lisa to clean the kitchen
IlcContext: Marta knows that either she or Lisa will have to clean the kitchen
IlcSpecificMem: Marta knows that Lisa volunteered to take the lead on cleaning the kitchen when she gets home from work this evening.
IlcExtras: In the afternoon, while Lisa is still at work, Marta and Brian are standing in the kitchen doorway, gazing in.
Explicit_belief_illocutor: Marta knwos that Brian doesn't know that Lisa volunteered to take the lead on cleaning the kitchen when she gets home from work this evening.
Illocutor_answer: To say that Lisa will clean up the kitchen

SharedMem:
["﻿Caroline accompanies her teenage daughter, Sarah, to the doctor so that she can be tested for allergies.",
"She’s quite reluctant to go, but Caroline promises her that after the appointment, they can go out to her favorite hamburger joint.", 
"The appointment goes well, and is very informative; as it turns out, Sarah does have several major food allergies.", 
"The doctor gives Caroline a pamphlet containing more detailed information.", 
"Then, as promised, Caroline takes Sarah to a nearby diner to buy some hamburgers.", 
"Caroline orders a hamburger and some fries for herself, a cheeseburger for Sarah, then sits down."]
ScenarioPremise: Sarah eyes Caroline’s plate of fries and says, “Man, those fries look delicious…"
Options:
["To offer her the fries",
"To say that Sarah is allergic to fries",
"To wait for an answer",
"To say that it's too bad that Sarah is allergic to fries"]
LcSpecificMem: Sarah doesn't know that she is allergic to members of the “nightshade” family, which includes eggplant and potatoes.
IlcContext: Caroline is happy that the doctor's appointment went well
IlcSpecificMem: Caroline flips through the pamphlet and she is surprised to learn that Sarah is allergic to members of the “nightshade” family, which includes eggplant and potatoes.
Explicit_belief_illocutor: Caroline knows that Sarah doesn't know to be allergic to members of the “nightshade” family, which includes eggplant and potatoes.
Illocutor_answer: To say that Sarah is allergic to fries

SharedMem:
["After a long week, John decides to treat himself to a dinner for one at the fanciest restaurant in town.",
"Just for the occasion, John breaks out his black and white tuxedo.", 
"When John arrives at the restaurant, he’s somewhat embarrassed to realize that he is wearing the exact same outfit as the restaurant’s waitstaff.",
"While John is waiting in line, he encounters another guest, who initially mistakes him for a waiter.",
"John laughes about the misunderstanding, and then an actual waiter shows him to his table.",
"Later, as John walks to the kitchen, he passes by the same guest’s table."]
ScenarioPremise: The guest says, “This steak is so overdone!”
Options:
["To remind him that they met in line",
"To say that he's sorry for his steak",
"To wait for an answer",
"To say that he doesn't work there"]
LcContext: The guest is staring down at his meal with irritation.
LcSpecificMem: The guest doesn't recognize John from the line
LcExtras: The guest looks up at John
IlcGoal: John wants to pay his compliments to the chef
IlcContext: John is satisfied with his dinner
IlcSpecificMem: John recognizes the guest from the line
IlcExtras: John passes by the guest table
Explicit_belief_illocutor: John knows that the guest doesn't recognize him from the line
Illocutor_answer: To remind him that they met in line

SharedMem:
["After Brian’s first year of college, he moves back home for the summer.",
"His parents are glad to have him home, but his dad insists that he does some weekly chores to “earn his keep”.", 
"Brian would prefer to just relax, but it does keep him occupied, which isn’t all bad.", 
"Besides, the house is in need of some repairs; his parents are both busy people, so some chores have fallen by the wayside while he has been away.", 
"Most notably, the lawn has gotten overgrown, and the paint on the backyard fence is beginning to peel.", 
"During the first couple of weeks, Brian mows the lawn, rakes the driveway, and waters the garden, but he keeps putting off painting the fence."]
ScenarioPremise: Brian's dad says “Man, that fence is looking worse than ever; a new paint-job couldn’t come soon enough.”
Options:
["To paint the fence",
"To say that  a painting company will come in two days from now",
"To wait for an answer",
"To say that he's glad that someone is coming soon to paint the fence."]
LcGoal: Brian's dad wants the fence to be painted
LcContext: Brian's father wants the house fixed up
LcSpecificMem: Brian's dad doesn't know that his wife called a painting company to come and paint the fence
LcExtras: Brian's dad walks in and peers out the window with a slightly displeased expression on his face.
IlcGoal: Brian wants to read his book
IlcContext: Brian doesn't mind helping his parents
IlcSpecificMem: Brian knows that his mother called a painting company to come and paint the fence; they schedule a time two days from now.
IlcExtras: Brian is reading in the living room
Explicit_belief_illocutor: Brian knows that his dad doesn't know that his wife called a painting company to come and paint the fence
Illocutor_answer: To say that a painting company will come in two days from now

SharedMem:
["After some deliberation, Carl invites a new acquaintance over for a dinner date.",
"Carl prepares a feast, which he serves alongside some red wine.", 
"There’s only a small amount of wine left in the bottle, but Carl assures his date he has another bottle stashed away."]

["To offer her another glass of wine",
"To say that there's no more wine",
"To wait for an answer",
"To say that he's sorry that there is no more wine"]
LcContext: Carl's date sips the last of their glass of wine.
